scenes.setting: A bustling modern-day office breakroom, complete with a water cooler, microwave, and a table littered with coffee mugs.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Our story begins with Macbeth, a mid-level manager with a serious ambition problem, and a penchant for misinterpreting fortune cookie messages.

dialogue.speaker: Macbeth
dialogue.line: You know, Banquo, this cookie says I'm destined for great things...like, maybe a corner office?

dialogue.speaker: Banquo
dialogue.line: Macbeth, it also says "Help, I'm trapped in a cookie factory!"

scenes.setting: Macbeth's apartment. Lady Macbeth is on the phone, pacing back and forth.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Enter Lady Macbeth, Macbeth's even more ambitious wife, who enjoys power yoga and reality TV.

dialogue.speaker: Lady Macbeth
dialogue.line: Macbeth, honey, it's King Duncan! He's coming over for a dinner party... TONIGHT?! Okay, don't panic, I just ordered a new self-cleaning tablecloth.

dialogue.speaker: Macbeth
dialogue.line: But, darling, King Duncan? Dinner? Tonight?

dialogue.speaker: Lady Macbeth
dialogue.line: Think of the promotion possibilities, Macbeth! Think of the corner office!

scenes.setting: Back in the breakroom, Macbeth looks pale and jittery as he stirs sugar into his coffee.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: The dinner party was a smashing success. Until, that is, it wasn't.

dialogue.speaker: Banquo
dialogue.line: You mean promoted? To the big office in the sky?

dialogue.speaker: Macbeth
dialogue.line: No, Banquo. I meant... well, never mind. Pass the sugar.

scenes.setting: The office, years later. Macbeth, now CEO, sits at his desk looking stressed and paranoid. Lady Macbeth is applying hand cream, staring out the window.

dialogue.speaker: Narrator
dialogue.line: Macbeth's reign of corporate terror was short-lived. Karma, it seems, has a nasty habit of biting back. With a stapler.

dialogue.speaker: Macduff
dialogue.line: Macbeth! We know about the sugar! And the stapler! It's time for your performance review.

dialogue.speaker: Macbeth
dialogue.line: You can't fire me! I quit! I'm going to go find myself...at the beach...with a good book...and no staplers!
